title: Insurance Product Life Cycle Management for Life & Annuity
summary: Insurance companies must adapt to the changing life and annuity needs of their customers over time, as young couples with children have different needs than retirees. Customers' concerns shift from affordability and coverage amount to tax advantages and legacy planning as they age. The article does not mention any specific green innovations, business innovations, green products, or green processes.
greenwashing: no reference to greenwashing in the provided text

title: The Importance of Income Elasticity in Decision Making
summary: Small companies may need to diversify their product line to attract consumers with less disposable income. One way to accomplish this is to provide new features for the products while keeping prices the same. New uses for products may attract consumers with more disposable income.
business_innovation: TRUE - new features or uses are added to keep prices low while increasing demand for an existing product.

title: Managing the product and the process record: Benefits of using product life cycle
summary: Integrating PLM with manufacturing systems synchronizes bill of material and routing information. This eliminates inefficiencies related to paper-based, error-prone processes and provides visibility into engineering change, BOM, and quality information. Manufacturers can enhance their product design and manufacturing practices even further to help eliminate inefficiencies, drive down manufacturing costs, and maintain a competitive advantage in the marketplace.
green_innovation: TRUE because the described manufacturing process management innovation contributes to environmental sustainability goals by reducing negative environmental externalities of human activity by providing visibility into engineering change, BOM, and quality information which can decrease waste.
business_innovation: TRUE because the described innovation is a new or improved manufacturing process that differs significantly from the firm’s previous manufacturing processes and provides greater efficacy, resource efficiency, and convenience.
green_product: FALSE because the article does not describe a specific product that meets the criteria to be a green product.
green_process: TRUE because the article describes a new or improved manufacturing process for one or more business functions that differs significantly from the firm’s previous business processes and promotes sustainability by helping reduce waste, conserve natural resources, and decrease energy consumption.
likely_naics_codes: ['334413 - Semiconductor and Related Device Manufacturing', '334418 - Printed Circuit Board Assembly (PCBA) Manufacturing', '334419 - Other Electronic Component Manufacturing', '335999 - All Other Miscellaneous Electrical Equipment and Component Manufacturing']
greenwashing: FALSE because the article describes what appears to be a genuine process for incorporating sustainability into product lifecycle management and manufacturing processes.
